input:

46:35 Caption: West Ham players are playing combination football and attempting to create a goal-scoring opportunity, but they will have to wait for that as they have just lost possession due to a poor pass.
48:24 Caption: The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
48:25 Caption: We can hope that the managers will be able to motivate the players and stir them to improve their performance for after the half-time break. We haven't seen really exciting football in the previous 45 minutes. In terms of the overall play, the match has been fairly even so far. Both sides have adopted a tactic known as kick and rush football.

Second Half:
00:00 Event: Kick-off by West Ham
00:00 Caption: Fourth official shows 3 min. of added time.
00:01 Caption: Craig Pawson blows his whistle and the second half starts.

47:48 Event: Shots on target by Manchester

48:04 Event: Yellow card by Manchester
48:04 Caption: Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the middle of the target, but Adrian was alert and the score remains the same.
48:40 Event: Direct free-kick by West Ham
48:42 Event: Ball out of play
48:47 Caption: Fernando (Manchester City) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
48:59 Event: Clearance by Manchester
49:00 Caption: Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a cross from the set piece. He jumps high but his towering header lacks a little bit of accuracy and crashes against the crossbar.
49:09 Caption: The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
49:10 Caption: The fans can't complain about what they saw on the pitch as both sides displayed a highly captivating football match. Neither of the teams could take the initiative and dominate today's game. Long balls and crosses were the main weapons of the home team, while the away team played possession football.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In a thrilling contest at the London Stadium, West Ham United and Manchester City played out a captivating 2-2 draw that exemplified the intensity and unpredictability that the Premier League is renowned for. From the first whistle to the final moments, the match was peppered with dramatic swings in momentum, well-taken goals, and strategic maneuvering by both sides.

The match kicked off with Manchester City quickly taking control, seeking to stamp their authority on the game. However, it was West Ham who made the early breakthrough in just under a minute of play. A quick attack culminated in a precise shot on target, which resulted in a goal for West Ham, sending their fans into raptures. It was a spectacular start for the Hammers, stunning City and setting the tone for an action-packed first half.

Manchester City, taken aback by the early goal, quickly resumed the kick-off and sought to reassert their dominance. Their attempts were soon interrupted by a foul from West Ham, giving City an indirect free-kick, but the Hammers' defense was prepared and managed to thwart the subsequent efforts. The game flowed back and forth with both teams finding it tough to keep possession for long as a series of balls went out of play, corners, and throw-ins.

West Ham had another opportunity in the sixth minute, but their shot went off target, missing an opportunity to double their lead. The game saw a series of fouls that disrupted the flow, and in the eighth minute, Manchester City was awarded a penalty after a West Ham infringement. The clinical precision of the ensuing spot-kick saw Manchester City equalize, a crucial moment to level the match at 1-1.

The first half was not without its physical toll, as West Ham was forced to make an early substitution in the 12th minute due to Carl Jenkinson's injury. Samuel Byram came on as his replacement, and West Ham adjusted their tactics accordingly. The match continued with a series of fouls and free-kicks as both teams battled hard to gain the upper hand.

Specifically, Manchester City's Nicolas Otamendi committed a foul that provided West Ham with a promising free-kick opportunity, although Dimitri Payet's delivery into the penalty area did not yield a scoring chance. The physicality of the contest was evident with Martin Demichelis of Manchester City receiving a yellow card for a late challenge by the 31-minute mark. West Ham's Mark Noble also joined the booking list later for a rough challenge. The half ended with both teams going hard at each other but not converting any further chances.

The halftime whistle signaled the end of a gripping first half that had thrilled the fans. At this juncture, both managers would have been eager to dissect their team's performances and make the necessary tactical adjustments to seize control of the game in the second half.

The second half began with West Ham kicking off and continuing the aggressive approach that had characterized their first-half performance. However, early in the half, there was a lot of back-and-forth play with numerous throw-ins and clearances. Manchester City was slightly more dominant in possession but found it challenging to penetrate West Ham’s resolute defense.

In the 5th minute, West Ham had a good opportunity from a corner taken by Dimitri Payet, but it was expertly cleared by the Manchester City defense. A sequence of missed opportunities and off-target shots followed for both sides, reflecting the tight contest and committed defense. In one key moment, a shot by Michail Antonio went just wide of the left post, showing just how finely balanced the game was.

West Ham took the lead again in the 10th minute of the second half thanks to a superbly orchestrated move. Enner Valencia received an excellent, defense-splitting pass inside the box and calmly slotted the ball into the bottom left corner, restoring West Ham’s advantage to 2-1. It was a testament to the strategic capabilities and clinical finishing of the Hammers.

Manchester City, now trailing once more, initiated a flurry of substitutions to reinvigorate their attack. Raheem Sterling came on for Jesus Navas, while West Ham also adjusted, bringing on Victor Moses for Michail Antonio. Both managers were clearly in search of the spark that could tip the balance in their favor.

Play continued with fierce intensity. The visitors managed a couple of good shots, one of which hit the post, denying them an equalizer. The tension was palpable as City sought to level the score yet again. Sergio Aguero had a glorious chance but his header went wide of the mark. Another crucial moment unfolded when Fabian Delph's shot crashed against the right post, epitomizing City's luckless evening in front of goal up to that point.

In the concluding stages of the match, City’s persistence eventually paid off. A powerful shot from the edge of the box by Sergio Aguero resulted in a rebound, which he promptly dispatched into the net, making no mistake this time. His equalizer in the 35th minute of the second half tied the game at 2-2, breathing new life into the visitors' attack.

With the clock ticking down, City made further changes, introducing Fernando for David Silva, hoping to see out the game without conceding further. West Ham reacted as well, exchanging Enner Valencia for Nikica Jelavic, signaling their intent to press for a late winner.

The final moments of the match were as tense as the opening ones. West Ham came agonizingly close to clinching the win when Cheikhou Kouyate’s header from a set-piece rattled the crossbar, in what was nearly a last-gasp win. Yet, it was not to be as City held firm.

Throughout, the match was a tactical battle with each side having its moments of dominance. Manchester City preferred to play through a possession-based strategy, often looking to exploit spaces with quick passing. On the other hand, West Ham's approach involved utilizing long balls and crossing, seeking to disrupt City's defensive cohesion with aerial duels and physical presence.

The match concluded with the referee’s whistle, ushering in the full-time score of 2-2. The London Stadium echoed with applause from the West Ham supporters who appreciated their team’s gallant effort against one of the league’s top sides. The away fans, too, had much to cheer given their team’s late equalizer that salvaged a valuable point.

In the end, both teams shared the spoils in a game that showcased resilience, skill, and moments of individual brilliance. It was a perfect example of why the Premier League continues to captivate audiences around the world, with two teams fully committed to showcasing entertaining and competitive football until the last minute.
